CHAPTER 705
Amusement Places
705.01   License required; fee.
705.02   License application.
705.03   License regulations.
705.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate shows and exhibitions - see Ohio R.C. 715.48, 715.63, 3765.02
Power to regulate billiard and poolrooms - see Ohio R.C. 715.51, 715.61
Power to regulate dancing academies or public ballrooms - see Ohio R.C. 715.61
County license for public shows - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 3765
State licensing of portable amusement devices - see OAC 901-11-01
Safety inspectors of portable amusement devices - see OAC 901-11-03
 
 
705.01 LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE.
   No person shall conduct any permanent, temporary or itinerant form of
amusement such as theatrical exhibitions, public shows or performances,
circuses or carnivals for which money or other reward is demanded or received,
unless that person shall first obtain a license and shall pay therefore the sum
of fifty dollars ($50.00) for the first day and twenty-five dollars ($25.00)
for each consecutive day that the amusement shall be held up to a maximum fee
of one hundred dollars ($100.00) in one calendar year. This requirement for
licensing shall not apply to entertainment, exhibitions or shows conducted by
school, civic, church or veterans organizations. (Ord. 32-10. Passed 11-22-10.)
705.02 LICENSE APPLICATION.
   Any person desiring to conduct or continue to conduct any form of amusement
identified in Section
705.01 shall fill out an application for an amusement license on a form
approved by the Municipal Manager. The form shall include, but not be limited
to the business entity providing the amusement, license business address of the
applicant, local contact information for the applicant’s principal person,
proof of public liability insurance in an amount not less than one hundred
thousand dollars ($100,000), and a deposit of a one thousand dollar ($1,000)
nuisance bond with the Municipality (which shall be returned to the applicant
at the end of the event provided that no municipal services were required to
clean, repair or otherwise remedy or abate any nuisances of the event). Upon
submission of a fully completed and notarized application, the appropriate
license/permit fee and the nuisance bond, the Municipal Manager may grant the
approval of the application and issue the license fee provided that the event
is not otherwise prohibited by law.
(Ord. 32-10. Passed 11-22-10.)
705.03 LICENSE REGULATIONS.
   An amusement license shall be valid only for the person or business entity
in whose name it is issued and only for the conduct of the amusements at the
place designated therein. It shall not be assignable and it shall be
conspicuously display at the place for which it was issued during the period of
all ticket sales and the term of the event.
(Ord. 32-10. Passed 11-22-10.)
705.99 PENALTY.
   Whosoever violates this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a minor
misdemeanor on the first offense. On a second or subsequent offense, a
violation of this chapter shall constitute a misdemeanor in the fourth degree.
Each day’s violation shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 32-10. Passed 11-22-10.)
CHAPTER 709
Auctions
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: Pursuant to Ohio R.C. 4707.01 et seq., the Ohio Department
of Commerce is solely responsible for the licensing of auctioneers.)
CHAPTER 713
Bowling Alleys and Billiard Rooms
713.01   License required.
713.02   Fees.
713.03   Premises to be orderly.
713.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.51, 715.61
Gambling - see GEN. OFF.
517.02 et seq.
 
 
713.01 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall operate a bowling alley or pool and billiard room without
first obtaining a license therefor from the Safety Director. No license shall
be granted for a period less than one year and licenses shall expire on
December 31.
713.02 FEES.
   (a)   Pool and billiard rooms: twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for the first
table and fifteen dollars ($15.00) for each additional table.
   (b)   Bowling alleys: twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for the first alley and
fifteen dollars ($15.00) for each additional alley. (Ord. 1603-97. Passed 5-27-
97.)
713.03 PREMISES TO BE ORDERLY.
   No person who owns or operates a billiard room or bowling alley shall fail
or neglect to keep such premises in a quiet, orderly and moral manner.
713.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. Each day on which a violation occurs or continues shall be
deemed a separate offense.
CHAPTER 715
Ice Cream Vendors
715.01   Sale of products from vehicle.
715.02   Vehicle lighting requirements.
715.03   Noise producing devices.
715.04   Sale to persons in street prohibited.
715.05   Insurance requisites.
