CHAPTER 931
Water and Sewer Regulations
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Pursuant to Ordinance 08-2019, passed April 22, 2019, Council
has enacted Water and Sewer Regulations governing water and sewer policies
within the Village as set forth below:
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate water closets and privies - see Ohio R.C. 715.40
Power to construct sewerage system - see Ohio R.C. 715.40, 717.01
Compulsory sewer connections - see Ohio R.C. 729.06
Regulations to control house sewers and connections - see Ohio R.C. 729.51
Interference with sewage flow - see Ohio R.C. 4933.24
Household sewage disposal systems - see OAC Ch. 3701-29
CHAPTER ONE
GENERAL INFORMATION AND DEFINITIONS
Section 1- Official Title of Utility Division
The water and sanitary sewer works of the Municipality of Sebring shall be
officially known as the Division of Water and Sewer, Department of Public
Service of the Municipality of Sebring, Ohio.
Section 2- Does Not Guarantee Quality of Service
The supply of water to all parties for any purpose whatever is subject to the
following conditions:
The Division of Water and Sewer does not guarantee to the consumer a fixed or
continuous water service or pressure, nor does it guarantee the water delivered
as to quality, color, odor, purity or temperature, these all being subject to
the variable conditions which may arise in the operation and maintenance of the
Water Works System, as well as other factors affecting water supply, treatment
and distribution.
Section 3- Water Mains May be Shut Off Without Notice
In case of breaks in mains, services, pumping machinery, reservoirs or other
water works equipment, and for the purpose of tapping, extending, repairing,
replacing or cleaning mains, the water may be shut off without giving notice,
and no consumer claims will be considered for damage of any nature whatsoever
arising from such action. Provided backflow prevention is approved.
Section 4- Provisions for a Reserve Supply of Water
Consumers whose operations require a constant and steady supply of water should
provide against interruptions in the service by installation of tanks,
reservoirs or other auxiliary supplies sufficient to carry them over the period
of interruption in service provided backflow prevention is approved.
Section 5- Right to Enter Premises
The Division of Water and Sewer reserves the right through its authorized
agents to enter at all reasonable hours the premises to which its service
extends for the purpose of reading, repairing, installing, removing or
inspecting meters or for any other purpose which it may deem necessary in
properly safe-guarding the interests of the Division of Water and Sewer and the
consumer.
When such access is refused, the water shall be immediately turned off and not
turned on again until the request of the Division of Water and Sewer has been
complied with, and an "OFF" charge of fifty dollars ($50.00) and an "ON" charge
of fifty dollars ($50.00) are paid by the consumer.
Section 6A- Definitions
   a)   Whenever the term "Municipal Manager" is used herein it shall be
construed to designate the Municipal Manager of the Municipality of Sebring,
unless otherwise designated.
   b)   Whenever the term "Administrative Assistant" is used herein, it shall
be construed to designate the Administrative Assistant of the Division of Water
and Sewer of the Municipality of Sebring, unless otherwise designated.
   c)   Whenever the term "Deputy Service Director" is used herein, it shall be
construed to designate the Deputy Service Director of the Municipality of
Sebring, unless otherwise designated.
   d)   Whenever the term "Waste Water System" is used herein, it shall be
construed to include all pipelines and equipment incident to the transportation
of sewage along the public ways or other way wherein the Municipality of
Sebring has a special interest, and also the Sewage Treatment Plant and all
property and equipment incident thereto.
   e)   Whenever it is provided herein that "notice be given" or other term or
phrase of similar meaning, such term or phrase shall be construed to mean
printed or written, and it shall be delivered personally to, left at the
residence of, or mailed to the last known address of the party to whom the same
is directed, is the sole discretion of the Village.
   f)   Whenever the term "Water Works System" is used herein, it shall be
construed to include all pipelines, mains and connections, pumping stations,
storage tanks and the like appurtenant to producing and distributing a supply
of water to consumers in the Municipality and locations outside of the
corporate limits which is supplied with the Municipality's water; and all
tools, apparatus and equipment necessary for that purpose.
   g)   Whenever the term "tap" is used herein, such term shall be construed as
the insertion of a saddle on a main for the purpose of installing a corporation
stop regardless of new construction or replacement.
   h)   Whenever the term "main" is used herein, such term shall be construed
as water lines which has been laid in public right-of-way and from which
service lines(s) of four (4) or more individual residences are tapped.
Whenever the term "main" is used herein, such term shall be construed as the
sewer line which has been laid in a public right-of-way and from which sewer
laterals are tapped.
   i)   Whenever the term "service line" or "service main" is used herein, it
shall be construed as that water line from and after the point of connection to
the corporation stop which carries water to an individual structure or building
through a single meter.
   j)   Whenever the term "service lateral" is used herein, it shall be
construed as the service line at the point of connection from sewer main to
property being served.
   k)   The masculine pronoun "He" and its derivatives, whenever employed,
include the feminine pronoun and its derivatives.
   l)   Whenever the term "corporation stop" or "ferrule" is used herein, it
shall be construed as a valve for joining a service pipe to a street water main
and cannot be operated from the surface.
   m)   Whenever the term "curb stop" is used herein, it shall be construed as
a water service shut off valve located in a water service line near the curb
and between the water main and the structure receiving water service.
Section 6B- Applicability
Any property owner who signs an application or who is served by water and sewer
service shall be subject to all regulations set forth herein, as may be amended
from time to time with or without notice. Any owner of any premises receiving
any water or sewer services shall remain responsible for all obligations set
forth in these regulations as may be amended from time to time with or without
notice. The payment of any invoice or bill shall constitute conclusive evidence
of the acceptance of all regulations set forth herein.
CHAPTER TWO
OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES
Section 7- Administrative Assistant Roles and Responsibilities
The Administrative Assistant shall prepare and preserve a correct account of
all receipts and disbursements of the Division of Water and Sewer, a register
of all users and consumers, and all other papers, documents and records
pertaining to the duties and functions of the Administrative Assistant in
accordance with Village policy.
Section 8- Compute Quarterly Bills
The Administrative Assistant shall, at the end of each quarter of each year,
compute, prepare and submit to each property owner a statement of charges and
rentals for the quarter just ending, unless monthly billing has been
established.
Section 9- Deposit Monetary Receipts Next Business Day
The Administrative Assistant shall collect money or credits due the Division of
Water and Sewer of the Municipality and shall deposit same in the bank on the
next business day for which deposits the Administrative Assistant shall obtain
proper receipts.
All such money or credits so collected and paid into the bank shall, by the
Administrative Assistant, be credited to the Water Works Rental Fund or Sewer
Rental Fund, as the case might be, to which fund respectively, they are
exclusively appropriated.
Section 10- Additional Administrative Assistant's Duties
In addition to the duties herein specifically imposed upon the Administrative
Assistant, he shall perform such other duties as may be imposed upon him from
time to time by the Municipal Manager or by Ordinance.
Section 11- Administrative Assistant Prepares a Quarterly Report to City
Manager
At the end of each quarter, the Administrative Assistant shall make a written
report to the Municipal Manager showing receipts, disbursements and financial
condition of all funds under his control.
Section 12- Administrative Assistant Shall Be Bonded
Before entering upon his duties as such, the Administrative Assistant shall be
bonded to the Municipality of Sebring for a sum determined to be adequate by
Council from time to time conditioned upon faithful performance of his duties.
Section 13- Administrative Assistant is Employee
The Administrative Assistant shall be employed as indicated by other Ordinances
of the Municipality.
Section 14- Deputy Service Director's Roles/Responsibilities
The Deputy Service Director, subject to control of the Municipal Manager, is
directly charged with the supervision of the Water Works System and Waste Water
System. He shall supervise the work of all employees necessary to insure the
proper functioning of the Water Works System and Waste Water System. He shall
maintain the Systems and all their separate parts in good repair. He shall
supervise and direct the installation of all water and sewer lines and service
connections, and enforce all rules and regulations enacted for the safety and
protection of the Water Works System and Waste Water System and the supplying
of water and disposal of wastes.
Section 15- Reading Meters
At least once each quarter, the Deputy Service Director shall have all water
meters accurately read, to the best of his knowledge, and make a complete
report, thereof to the Administrative Assistant. Such meter reading shall be
made as near as possible to the beginning of the following quarter but at such
time as will enable him to make complete a report to the Administrative
Assistant by the fifteenth day of the first month of the following quarter
(i.e., March, June, September and December). Failure to make such a reading
shall not preclude the Village from collecting for service provided.
Section 16- Deputy Service Director Supplies
The Deputy Service Director shall acquire by purchase or otherwise all
necessary supplies, repairs, replacements and the like for the proper operation
of the Water Distribution System and the Waste Water Collection System, except,
however, no single item of supply or repairs involving an expenditure in excess
of One Thousand Dollars ($1000.00) shall be contracted for, unless specifically
authorized by the Municipal Manager.
Section 17- Deputy Service Director and Written Reporting
At the end of each quarter the Deputy Service Director may make a written
report to the Municipal Manager concerning the operation, condition and
equipment of the Division of Water and Sewer. In addition to the duties herein
specifically imposed upon the Deputy Service Director, he shall perform such
other duties as may be imposed upon him from time to time by the Municipal
Manager.
Section 18- Deputy Service Director's Inventory Reports
Immediately upon assuming his duties the Deputy Service Director shall prepare
and file with the Administrative Assistant a full and complete itemized
inventory of all property belonging to the Division of Water and Sewer,
fixtures excluded. Before being relieved of his obligation as such Deputy
Service Director, he shall make a full accounting to the Municipal Manager of
all property listed in his inventory and by him acquired, supplies and articles
lost by use, general wear and tear, breakage or lost through causes beyond
control of the Deputy Service Director, excepted.
Section 19- Deputy Service Director is Employee
The Deputy Service Director shall be employed as provided by other Ordinances
of the Municipality.
Section 20- Deputy Service Director Shall Be Bonded
Immediately upon entering his duties as such, the Deputy Service Director shall
be bonded to the Municipality of Sebring by surety bond for a sum determined by
Council to be adequate from time to time, conditioned upon the faithful
performance of his duties and the proper accounting of all properties under his
charge.
Section 21- Plant Superintendents Roles/Responsibilities
The Plant Superintendents of the Water Treatment Plant and Waste Water
Treatment Plant, subject to the control of the Municipal Manager, under
supervision of the Deputy Service Director are directly charged with the proper
functioning of the Plants. They shall maintain the Plants and all separate
parts in good repair, supervise the lab, (state reports, tests, etc.) enforce
all rules and regulations enacted by the Municipal Manager for the safety and
protection of the Plants and Waste Water discharge. In addition to the duties
herein specifically imposed upon them, they shall perform such other duties as
may be imposed upon them from time to time by the Municipal Manager or by
Ordinance. The Plant Superintendent shall supervise and direct all other
employees working in each respective plant.
CHAPTER THREE
APPLICATION FOR WATER SERVICE
Section 22A- Application Form for Water Service
No water service shall be furnished to any dwelling, store, factory,
institution or place of business until the owner shall have executed and
delivered to the Administrative Assistant a written application thereof.
When such application shall have been executed and filed, it shall constitute a
contract between the party executing it and the Municipality and shall remain
in full force and effect until withdrawn by the executing party or service
terminated by the Municipality. Such termination by the Municipality shall not
render void anything accrued thereunder in favor of the Municipality up to the
date of such termination.
Section 22B- Status at Property Sale; Application [Codified-Section 933.10
(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)]
   a)   Statement of Status of Water and Sewer Bill to be Supplied by Seller No
person, agent, firm or corporation shall sell by deed, land contract or
otherwise any interest in any premises within the Municipality, or which is
supplied with Sebring water and/or sewer service without furnishing the buyer
prior to the sale a statement from the Sebring Water Department setting forth
the current status of the water and/or sewer account of such premises, and when
an escrow has been established, depositing in escrow prior to delivery of
possession or transfer of title a statement from the buyer acknowledging the
receipt of this document and accepting responsibility for all future water and/
or sewer bills in accordance with this chapter.
   b)   Escrow Agent: Disbursal of Funds Without Statement Prohibited No
person, firm or corporation acting in the capacity of an escrow agent in any
real estate transaction involving the sale of any premises situated within the
Municipality or which is supplied with Sebring water and/or sewer service shall
disburse any funds unless the provisions of this section have been met.
   c)   Application for Water and/or Sewer Service Applications for the use of
water and/or sewer service for which the applicant agrees to pay shall be made
and accepted in a manner prescribed by the Municipal Manager. Provided,
however, that any owner of real estate premises installing or maintaining a
water and/or service connection shall be considered as accepting the provisions
of all lawful rules and regulations of the Department of Water and Sewer, and
as agreeing in particular to be liable for all water and/or sewer service
charges for the premises.
   d)   That Chapter 3B-Status at Property Sale; Application, subsection e) is
hereby amended as follows:
   e)   Penalties for Non-Payment If any consumer refuses or neglects to pay
any delinquent water and/or sewer bill including the collection charge thereon
if any, the water and/or sewer service shall be turned off without further
notice and not turned on again until all charges due and payable have been paid
in full. If payment is made prior to 3:00 PM after the water and/or sewer
service has been shut off for nonpayment, service shall be restored the same
day. If payment is received after 3:00 PM after service has been shut off for
non-payment, service will be restored on the next business day. Customers who
wish to have their water and/or sewer service restored prior to the next
business day must pay an additional after hour's charge of One Hundred Dollars
($100.00). The provisions of this section shall apply whether or not there has
been a change of ownership or possession of the premises supplied by water and/
or sewer service. Except in cases of bankruptcy or foreclosure proceedings, no
water and/or sewer service shall be restored to a premises unless and until all
past due amounts relating to the water and/or sewer service to that premises
has been paid in full to the Municipality.
Codified, Section 933.99 PENALTY Whoever violates any provision of Section
933.10 (d) of the Codified Ordinances is guilty of a misdemeanor of the first
degree.
   f)   That the Sebring Codified Ordinances Section 933.10(d) is hereby
amended exactly as set forth above.
   g)   That all other provisions of the Regulations of the Division of Water
and Sewer Department of Public Service for the Municipality of Sebring, Ohio,
which are not specifically amended herein shall remain in full force and
effect. Any former provisions of the Regulations of the Division of Water and
Sewer of the Department of Public Safety for the Municipality of Sebring, Ohio,
which are contrary to the amendment set forth herein, are hereby repealed.
   h)   Any provision of the Sebring Codified Ordinances Section 933.10 which
is not specifically modified herein shall remain in full force and effect. Any
former provision of Section 933.10 which is contrary to the amendment set forth
herein shall be repealed.
Section 22C- Cannot Have Sewer Service Without Water Service if it's Available
No sewer service application shall be accepted or approved by the Village of
Sebring unless the property served shall apply for and obtain water service to
the premises, if municipal water service is also available to the premises. The
purpose of this regulation is to require all applicants for a sewer tap to
apply for and receive a water tap for any premises, if municipal water service
is available to the premises. If municipal water is not available then the
current water system supplying the premises must be metered for billing
purposes.
Section 23- Ownership Change and Land Contract Sales
Whenever the title of ownership to any property being served with water under
an application executed by the owner thereof is changed, a new application
shall forthwith be executed and delivered before any water may be served to
such property.
Whenever there is a change of title as above set forth, the Administrative
Assistant shall issue a written order to the Deputy Service Director to
disconnect the service to such property provided that any failure or delay in
making such disconnection shall not avoid any liability on the part of the
applicant whose application remains on file with the Administrative Assistant.
The Administrative Assistant will presume service being continuous from the
time service is connected at the request of the owner until the owner either
gives notice in writing to the Administrative Assistant to discontinue such
service or withdraws his original application.
Property sold on Land Contract: The account shall remain in the name of the
property owner, but the account billing may be sent to land contract purchaser.
If there are any delinquent charges whether water, sewer or miscellaneous on
property previously purchased on land contract by the same party, services will
be refused until such delinquent charges are paid.
Section 24A- New Service Line Connections/Taps
Property owners requiring new water service connections shall file a written
application, therefore, with the Administrative Assistant in form above
described and shall therewith pay a fee as indicated by Section 28b.
Section 24B- Length of New Service Line Connections/Taps
After a tap application has been filed with the administrative assistant, the
form will be forwarded to the Deputy Service Director for review. In his
determination, if the water tap is 100 feet or less, he may approve the
request. If the service line is greater than 100 feet he will forward the tap
application to council for approval.
Section 25- Each Building/Structure Needs Its Own Service Line
Each building or structure must be serviced by a separate and independent water
line connection to the main; and no more than one (1) building or structure may
be serviced from the same water service line connection. No application for
water service shall be allowed to any premises not in compliance with this
section.
Section 26- Sewer Tap Permits
No person shall tap or use any public sewer or connect any private drain
without first obtaining a permit. Such permit when allowed by the appropriate
authority shall be issued by the Administrative Assistant. No provision in this
section contained shall apply to the owner of any property whose sewer
connection in all other respects conforms to these Regulations.
Section 27- Sewer and Water Tap Fees and Miscellaneous Charges
Property owners requiring a new sewer service connection with the main sewer
lines shall first file a written application with the Administrative Assistant.
The application shall be accompanied by a fee established in the following
manner:
   a)   Single family residence inside corporate limits shall be $200.00. Users
outside the corporate limits shall be $400.00.
   b)   ¾" Water Tap   $500.00
      1" Water Tap   $750.00
      Any larger taps are based on material costs.
      * Plus meter set up fee: $150.00
Water taps for fire line only - sprinkler systems - no other use on regular
basis = + 10% of contractor's quote.
   c)    Miscellaneous and Equipment Use 
Repair or replace water tap: remove meter cost and current cost of curb box if
neither is being replaced.
Repair Sewer Tap: Inspection fee only.
Repair of frozen/broken meters: Cost of parts and trip fee.
Trip fee: Fifty Dollars ($50.00) trip fee for delinquencies, meter damage,
timed service call with no show, etc.
Section 28- Swimming Pools
Swimming Pools: Pool owners must record water meter readings in order to have
sewer charges deducted. The readings must be on file in the Administrative
Assistant's office. The sewer deduction may be used on the first initial
filling for the season (new or existing). Additional water added to the pool
due to use or evaporation is done so at regular water/sewer charges. Necessary
repair work that causes the need to refill a pool may also have sewer charges
deducted as long as the appropriate readings are supplied.
Section 29- Extending Water Lines
Whenever it shall appear reasonably necessary that water lines shall be
extended along the public way where none had been previously provided, the
parties interested therein should obtain from Council a form of petition
therefore, which, when properly signed and all the conditions thereof
fulfilled, shall be filed with the Administrative Assistant and the Deputy
Service Director shall bring the same before the Council for final action
thereon.
Whenever water lines are to be extended beyond the corporate limits, the
parties interested therein should obtain from the Administrative Assistant a
form of petition, therefore, which, when properly signed and all the conditions
thereof fulfilled, shall be filed with the Administrative Assistant and the
Deputy Service Director shall bring the same before the Council for final
action.
Section 30- Extension of Sewer Lines in Areas Inside and Outside the Corporate
Limits by Approval of Council
Whenever it shall appear reasonably necessary that sewer lines shall be
extended along the public way where none had been previously provided, the
parties interested therein should obtain from the Administrative Assistant a
form of petition therefore, which when properly signed and all conditions
thereof fulfilled, shall be filed with said Administrative Assistant and the
Deputy Service Director shall bring the same before the Council for final
action.
Whenever sewer lines are to be extended beyond the corporate limits, the
parties interested therein should obtain from the Administrative Assistant a
form of petition, therefore, which when properly signed and all conditions
thereof fulfilled, shall be filed with said Administrative Assistant and the
Deputy Service Director shall bring the same before the Council for final
action.
Section 31- Property Owner Versus Grandfathered Tenants
   a)   Effective January 1, 2015, all new water and/or sewer account
applications shall be registered in the name of the property owner only. All
utility bills thereafter will be mailed to the property owner's address on a
quarterly basis. Tenants and renters shall no longer be able to apply for a
utility account in their name.
   b)   All existing tenant and renter registered utility accounts shall be
considered grandfathered in and valid until such time as the account is closed
or transferred. Upon closure or transfer of a tenant or renter account, Section
32 (a) shall apply.
Section 32- Delivery of Water Bills and Failure to Receive the Bill
The Division of Water will undertake to deliver bills for water and/or sewer by
depositing same in the Post Office only as a matter of convenience to the owner
or consumer; failure to receive bills shall not relieve any person from their
obligation in the payment of such bills.
Section 33A- Delinquent Owner/Grandfathered Tenant of More Than One Property
Can Lose Water Service at Any of Their Properties
Whenever a property owner or grandfathered tenant becomes delinquent in the
payment of water bills, fees, or of any other obligation to the Division of
Water and Sewer, the supply of water may be shut off from any premises of such
property owner or grandfathered tenant, notice of such action having previously
been given as provided in these regulations, regardless of whether such
indebtedness was incurred at the premises where service is discontinued or at
any other property of such property owner or grandfathered tenant.
Section 33B- Cannot Establish New Water Service if Delinquent on Another
Account
No person or entity shall be entitled to establish any new water and sewer
account if the person or entity is currently delinquent on any water or sewer
account. In the event that the person or entity resolves said delinquency by
payment in full, a new water account may be properly applied for and opened.
Section 34- Illegal Use of Water
In case where the water has been turned off for non-payment of bills and it is
found turned on again, or when in the opinion of the Deputy Service Director
the turning off of the water at the curb stop is not a sufficient protection
against illegal use, then the service may be turned off at the corporation
stop. Upon a re-application for water where a corporation stop has been so
turned off, a fee of One Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($1500.00) for turning
on will be made.
Section 35- No Water Service will be provided if debt is owed to The Village
whether a Utility Bill or Equipment, Materials, Etc.
No water shall be supplied to any premises the owner of which is delinquent in
the payment of water bills, or who is indebted to the Division of Water and
Sewer for material, supplies or work done, or in any other manner until such
indebtedness has been paid, whether that indebtedness was incurred at the
premise for which service is sought or at any other place within or without the
Municipality; and the Division of Water and Sewer reserves to itself the right
to shut off the water from any premise owned by a person so delinquent. The
delivery of such notice at the premise where the water is used shall be
considered sufficient notification. When water is turned off on account of any
delinquency, it will not be turned on until all delinquencies have been paid
together with an "off" charge of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) and an "on" charge of
Fifty Dollars ($50.00.)
Section 36- Fire Hydrant Use/Meter Set Up Fee
Water used for public improvements performed under the special assessment plan
must be paid for before receiving final estimate from the Engineer, and if such
water supply is obtained from fire hydrants, a permit for the use of such
hydrant must be obtained as required in all other cases. All water used from
hydrants must be metered and have a backflow valve installed, and a set up fee
of Twenty Dollars ($20.00) will be charged. A criminal charge will be issued
for theft of water from a municipal-owned fire hydrant.
Section 37- Water Leaks and Meter Test Fee
No deduction shall be made or rebate allowed to any consumer of water under
meter control by or on account of leakage or alleged leakage in any water pipe,
tank or other apparatus or device. The amount of water registered by any meter
shall be charged and paid for in full, irrespective of whether such water after
having been registered was lost by leakage, accident or otherwise. Meters shall
be presumed accurate. A charge of One Hundred Fifty Dollars ($150.00) shall be
charged for checking a meter.
Section 38- Delinquent Water/Sewer Assessments
The Division of Water and Sewer will make every possible effort to collect
water bills and assessments as promptly as the nature and volume of its
business permits, but no consumer or owner of property shall be relieved from
an obligation for assessments that may be unpaid through delay or failure of
the Division to make collections as provided by its Regulations.
Section 39- Assistance With High Utility Bills
The Division of Water and Sewer deplores waste and excessive bills and will
lend its assistance in preventing such. Accordingly consumers should
immediately report cases where bills seem high and the Division of Water and
Sewer will then lend its assistance in attempting to discover and correct the
waste. This section shall not relieve the consumer of any other obligations
herein.
CHAPTER FOUR
RATES AND CHARGES
Section 40- Inspecting a Plumber- Installed Meter
The original meter will be delivered to the plumber and upon installation by
him, the service inspected by the Division of Water and Sewer when the regular
purchase price of the meter is paid to the Administrative Assistant.
Section 41- 20% Beloit Surcharge and 75% Surcharge Outside City Limits (Water)
Each user of water service shall pay quarterly for all water furnished him
during said quarter, as indicated by his water meter according to the schedule
of rates established by Council and in effect. A surcharge of seventy five
percent (75%) of the foregoing rates shall apply to all users outside the
corporate limits of Sebring, Ohio except for the Village of Beloit. Beloit is
under a separate contract and pays a contract surcharge. [See Ordinance #1516-
92 - 75% surcharge except Beloit).
Section 42- 75% Surcharge Outside City Limits (Sewer)
Each user of sanitary sewer service shall pay quarterly for all sewage disposed
of during said quarter as indicated by his water meter if serviced with water
by the Division; otherwise as estimated by the Division of Water and Sewer,
according to the schedule of rates established by Council and in effect. A
surcharge of seventy-five percent (75%) of the foregoing rates shall apply to
all users outside the corporate limits of Sebring, Ohio. [See Ordinance #1516-
92 - 75% surcharge except Beloit].
Section 43-Utility Bill Due Date, Penalties, Trip Notes, Off/On Fees, Payment
Plans, and NSF Check Charges
All charges for water and sewer service as provided for in Sections 42 and 43
above plus any miscellaneous charges shall become due and payable quarterly on
the first day of each January, April, July and October at the office of the
Administrative Assistant, or such other place in the Municipality of Sebring as
the Manager may designate. If any one or all of such charges be not paid on or
before the last working day of the month in which it becomes due, then said
charges shall be increased by ten percent (10%), and if not paid in an
additional fifteen (15) days, then said services shall be discontinued and the
Administrative Assistant, without further notice or order, shall issue their
written order to the Deputy Service Director to disconnect such service. The
Deputy Service Director, to whom such order is directed, shall execute the
same. However, a trip note may also be delivered to the premises allowing an
additional five days (5), after which time water service will be discontinued
and not reestablished until said account is paid in full with additional fees
of, Thirty-Five dollars ($35.00) for trip fee delivery, Fifty Dollar ($50.00)
to turn service off and an additional Fifty Dollars ($50.00) to re-establish
service. At the discretion of the Municipal Manager a payment plan may be
implemented for payment, however, a balance will not be carried over into the
next billing quarter. Water usage and fees are non-negotiable.
There shall be a Thirty-Five dollar ($35.00) charge for any bad checks received
by the Division of Water and Sewer.
Section 44- Delinquent Sewer Bills
In any instance where sewer service has been discontinued for failure to pay
the charges as provided in Sections 42 and 43 above, or any other violation of
these Regulations, a Fifty Dollar ($50.00) "on" charge and a Fifty Dollar
($50.00) "off" charge shall first be paid to the Administrative Assistant
before such service may be reconnected and resumed. The Application of anyone
for either water or sewer service may be denied so long as such applicant is
indebted to the Municipality for any charge or service accrued under these
Regulations.
Section 45- Failure to Receive a Utility Bill
As a matter of convenience only, the Administrative Assistant is directed to
mail or deliver quarterly statements for water and sewer service, but any
failure on the part of the Administrative Assistant to mail or deliver such
statement, or failure to receive such statement on the part of anyone, shall
not in any manner constitute a valid cause or excuse for non-payment.
Section 46- Who is Authorized to Collect and Receive Payments
No officer or employee of the Division of Water and Sewer, except the
Administrative Assistant is authorized to receive or receipt any payment for
Water or Sewer service, or any other charge, or the defined herein.
Section 47 - Certifications/Property Liens
Any charges for water and sewer or any miscellaneous charges accrued in any
manner herein shall constitute a lien upon the property served and if not paid
when due, may be certified to the County Auditor and be collected in the same
manner as other taxes are collected.
Section 48- Metered Water and Set Up Fee
Whenever anyone requires water service for a temporary, special or
extraordinary use, he shall make application therefore and first contract with
the Division of Water and Sewer upon a fair and reasonable charge for the
service to be determined by the Administrative Assistant. Said service shall be
metered and will have a backflow valve installed. A set up fee of $50.00 will
be charged for the installation of the meter and backflow preventer.
Section 49- Water Use and Purpose
Water shall not be used for any other purpose than the usual and ordinary uses
incident and pertinent to the use and occupancy of the property specified in
the application for service.
CHAPTER FIVE
TAPS, MAINTENANCE, INSPECTIONS, AND REPAIRS
Section 50- Adequate/Defective Plumbing
Whenever an application for water service is filed with the Administrative
Assistant, it is assumed that the piping and fixtures in the property to be
supplied are sufficient and in proper order to receive the same, and the
Municipality shall not be liable in any event for accident, break or leakage
arising in any manner in connection with the supply of water, or failure of
supply.
Water and Sewer service may be refused to any building wherein the water pipes
or sanitary plumbing is found to be defective, of substandard material, or in
violation of any ordinance or state law until such time as the defect or
violation has been terminated or repaired.
Section 51- Meter Installation Guidelines
Water meters shall be installed in a horizontal position with a shut off on
both sides of meter inside the building and at a point on the incoming service
pipe as close as possible to the building or foundation wall. The property
owner shall provide suitable housing facilities for the meter in a place
readily accessible and shall at all reasonable times insure unobstructed access
to the authorized agents and employees of the Division of Water and Sewer for
reading, inspection, repair or removal.
Meters damaged by abuse, misuse or accident, not by fair wear and tear, and by
freezing will be repaired and replaced at the cost of the owner of the property
being serviced. Only 5/8" meters will be replaced at the expense of the
Division of Water and Sewer. All other meters will be repaired at the cost of
the property owner.
Section 52- Alternate Meter Installation Method
If the water meter cannot conveniently and safely be installed within a
building, the owner of the property shall construct an above ground housing
which is properly insulated to prevent the freezing of the meter. Plans for
such housings and the installation of large meters shall be approved by the
Deputy Service Director before construction is commenced. It shall be the
responsibility of the owner of the property to keep the meter housing free of
snow and ice and other obstructive materials.
Section 53- Boilers
In all cases where domestic boilers are supplied, a suitable safety, vacuum or
relief valve must be supplied to prevent damage from collapsing or otherwise
when the water is shut off from the street mains and an approved reduced
pressure backflow preventer installed after meter.
When boilers are connected with furnaces or other heaters, it shall be done in
such a manner as to prevent damage to the water meter and to the boiler and its
appurtenances when the water is turned off from the street mains and drained.
Any damage caused to the meter due to the above is the responsibility of the
owner.
Section 54- Proper Meter Functioning Percentages
Upon examination and test of meters, after they have been in service a
reasonable length of time, meters must register with the following percentages
of the actual amount of water passed through them:
5/8" meters with 2% plus or minus on all streams from 20 gallons per minute
down to 1 gallon per minute, and within 10% minus on ½ gallon per minute;
¾" meters within 2% plus or minus on all streams from 35 gallons per minute
down to 1 gallon per minute, and within 10% minus on ½ gallon per minute;
1" meters within 2% plus or minus on all streams from 60 gallons per minute
down to 3 gallons per minute, and within 10% minus on ¾ gallon per minute;
2" meters within 2% plus or minus on all streams from 320 gallons per minute
down to 15 gallons per minute, and within 10% minus on 4 gallons per minute.
Water meter testing schedule is as follows:
Meter sizes 1 inch to 4 inch, tested every 5 years.
Meter sizes 4 inch and larger, tested every year.
Residential and commercial 5/8 meters are provided for under sections 38.
Section 53 provides 5/8 meters are set at the expense of the municipality and 1
inch and larger at the expense of the property owner.
Meters 1 inch and larger may be tested either by in-line testing or by meter
replacement (2 meters, one in service and the second being tested) with all
testing information forwarded to the Village of Sebring. Failure to provide
required information shall result in water disconnection.
Section 55- Removing Meters
Water meters shall be removed from their mountings by no one other than
authorized employees or agents of the Division of Water and Sewer, except that
a duly licensed plumber if employed by the property owner to drain the pipes of
any building preliminary to discontinuing the water service, may dismount the
meter after shutting off the water service, but then he shall forthwith deliver
the meter to the Deputy Service Director.
Section 56- Sealed Meters
All water meters shall be sealed.
Section 57- Meter Tampering
If it is found that a meter seal has been broken, or that any bypass has been
inserted, or there is evidence that the meter has been tampered with, the water
will be shut off and shall not be turned on again until the property owner of
the premises shall pay a Five Hundred Dollar ($500.00) fee plus the cost to
restore the meter to proper working order and any other necessary expense, all
as determined by the Deputy Service Director. Any person or persons making a
connection on a service line between the water meter and the street mains or
installing a bypass around the meter shall be subject to prosecution as may be
provided for by statute or ordinance.
Section 58- Who Can Turn Water On for Tests/Curb Stops
No one but authorized agents of the Division of Water and Sewer are permitted
to turn on the water service to any property except a licensed plumber may, for
the purpose of testing only, turn on the water service temporarily. As soon as
his test is completed he shall again turn off the service by closing the curb
stop at the curb box. Upon completion of the test, the plumber shall make his
report to the Deputy Service Director.
Curb stops are for the exclusive use of the Division of Water and Sewer except
as defined just above, and they shall never be used or tampered with by any
other person. The control of the water supply by the consumer shall be by means
of a separate stop and waste located generally just inside the building wall.
Section 59- City's Right to Shut Off Water
The Municipality undertakes to use reasonable care and diligence to provide a
constant supply of water at a reasonable pressure, but reserves the right at
any time, without notice, to shut off the water in its mains for the purpose of
making repairs or extensions or for other purposes. It is expressly provided
that the Municipality will not be liable for a deficiency or failure,
regardless of the cause, in the supply of water or in the pressure, nor for any
damage caused thereby, or by the bursting or breaking of any main or service
pipe, or any attachment to the Municipal property. All property owners having
boilers upon their premises and depending upon the pressure in the Municipal
pipes to keep them supplied are cautioned against danger of collapse, and all
such damage must be borne exclusively by the property owner.
Section 60- Sewer Line Repairs
The Division of Water and Sewer shall repair or cause to be repaired all sewer
mains under the direct supervision of the Deputy Service Director. All other
sewer lines are to be maintained at the owner's expense. No one may repair,
tamper with or attempt to remove obstruction from any sewer or sewer lateral
except within private property lines, except under express authority by and
under direct supervision of the Deputy Service Director. No sewer, sewer
lateral or connection except those within private property lines shall be so
repaired or cleaned. All sewer taps are to be made with use of the appropriate
sized saddle on the sewer main.
Section 61- Deputy Service Director Will Inspect New Sewer Taps
Whenever any person or firm being the holder of a sewer permit is about to tap
any sewer or make connection therewith, he shall cause notice thereof to be
made to the Deputy Service Director a reasonable time in advance so as to
permit him if he so desires to be present to inspect the work. Whoever shall
have caused such tap or connection to be made shall not cover or cause the
connection or tap to be covered until the same shall have been inspected and
approved by the Deputy Service Director.
Section 62- Permit Required for New Taps/Connections
The Deputy Service Director shall approve no tap or connection until a written
permit, signed by the Administrative Assistant, shall have been presented to
him. Whenever any tap or connection has been inspected and approved by him, he
shall cause a dated certificate to that effect to be filed with the
Administrative Assistant.
Section 63- Toxins Dumped in Sewer
No person, firm or corporation being the owner, lessee, tenant or occupant of
the lands, buildings or tenements in the Municipality of Sebring shall cause,
allow or permit to be discharged into the sanitary sewer system of said
municipality from the lands, buildings or tenements which such person, firm or
corporation may own, or use as lessee, tenant or occupant, any surface water or
drainage water from such buildings or tenements, or highly inflammable or
explosive matter, or any other matter, save and except such other matter as is
generally defined and recognized as sanitary sewerage waste.
Any person, firm or corporation found guilty of discharging such substances
into the sanitary sewer system shall be given written order to cease such
discharging. Failure to comply with said order will result in the termination
of water and sewer service and charged for any and all fees to execute the
termination. Service will not be restored to the offending property until proof
of compliance is provided to the Deputy Service Director.
Nothing contained in this section shall be construed to include seepage or
leakage into any trunk or main sewerage line constructed by the municipality
over or under privately or publicly owned lands.
Section 64- Deface, Damage of Water/Wastewater Property
The commission of any act tending to deface damage or obstruct in any manner
any building, machinery, pipes, manholes, mains or other apparatus or fixtures
of the Water Works and Sewerage Systems is expressly forbidden.
Section 65 Owner Must Submit a Written Request to Discontinue Water
Whenever anyone voluntarily discontinues either water or sewer services he
shall at once notify the Administrative Assistant in writing of such
discontinuance.
Section 66- Tapping Mains Only by Division of Water and Sewer
No person except an authorized employee of the Division of Water and Sewer, or
designee of the Deputy Service Director, will be permitted to tap or make any
connection with the mains or distribution pipes of the Water Works System.
Section 67- Property Owner to Pay Cost of Service Connection
All service connections or pipes for supplying water from municipal mains must
be installed at the expense of the property owner.
Section 68- Size of Service Connections Permitted
Service connections will be permitted in ¾" and 1" in diameter only, at the
option of the applicant. The consent of the Deputy Service Director must be
obtained in all cases where a service larger than one inch (1") in diameter is
desired.
Section 69- Abandoning Services
When a request is made for abandoning a service branch to a property which is
already served, the Division of Water and Sewer shall make the shut off at the
corporation stop and the property owner will be charged for labor and equipment
and supplies for doing so. Actual charges for equipment will be based on time,
equipment, materials, etc. determined by the Deputy Service Director.
Section 70- Owner Responsible for Not Shutting off Abandoned Services
The discovery of abandoned services which had not been shut off at the main
will result in the current property owner being held liable for the cost of
shutting off such service by the Division of Water and Sewer, together with
such damage as may be sustained by reason of leaks that may have developed.
Section 71- Owner Must Have a Permit Before Plumber May Begin Work
No plumber or other person shall extend a service from the main or curb stop to
any premises unless the owner thereof or his authorized agent has first secured
the necessary permit from the Division of Water and Sewer to do so.
Permits will be issued only to the owner or a bonded plumber registered with
the Municipality and must be secured not later than 24 hours in advance of the
time proposed for performance of the work.
Section 72- Water Supply From Other Sources Not to be Connected with Municipal
Supply
No arrangement shall be allowed whereby there may be any possibility of rain,
river, well or other water of any source flowing into the Municipal mains or
service lines.
No service pipe connected with the Municipal mains shall be connected with
pipes supplied with water from any other source except upon written permission
by the Ohio EPA, which permit shall be revocable at any time.
Every service so connected shall be equipped with a back flow prevention valve
to be installed in accordance with the requirements of the Ohio EPA.
Section 73- Back Flow Prevention Valves to be Provided When Two Services are
Used 
When any premises are supplied with water from two or more standard services,
such services must be provided with a reduced pressure back flow prevention
valves so that water can flow into the premises but cannot flow out through
either of the services.
Section 74- Curb and Corporation Stops Under Control of Water Works
The curb stop as well as the corporation stop shall be under the absolute
control of the Division of Water and Sewer and must not be tampered or
interfered with or operated by unauthorized persons. Water may be turned on to
premises to be supplied by an authorized employee of the Division of Water and
Sewer only, except that a licensed plumber may, for testing purposes, turn the
water on but must shut it off again when through testing.
   a)   When by request a water service is separated for use for outside use
only (no sewer charge) a separate meter will be installed with backflow
prevention and the water use for sewer will be deducted from bill.
Section 75- Location and Material used for Service Connection
Service mains to premises must be run on a direct line with the service branch
in the street, at right angle with the street, and at no less depth than four
feet (4'). From the corporation stop to the curb stop the service main (line)
must be of type K copper line; from the curb stop to the meter, the service
main (line) must be type K copper line or PE-3306 Class 160 Polyethylene
Plastic Water tubing, at the applicant's option.
All service lines which require a street crossing in a dedicated street must be
installed by boring under the street and proper backfill with compaction. No
road cuts will be allowed.
Section 76- When Service Connections May be Placed in Sewer Trenches
Service mains shall not be placed in the same trench with sewer connections
except by special permission and must otherwise be approved by the authorized
representative of the Division of Water and Sewer in its sole discretion. Where
permission is granted to place service mains in sewer trenches, they must be
put on a shelf at least twelve inches (12") wide cut into the side of the
trench and such trenches shall not be back-filled until the work has been
inspected and approved by an authorized representative of the Division of Water
and Sewer. Request for such inspection must be made at the Water Works office
before 12:00 noon of the day on which such inspection is desired.
Section 77- Stop and Waste Stops Must be Installed
All service pipes for domestic supply must be provided with an approved stop
and waste stop where it enters the building, easily accessible and so installed
that the water can be shut off and drained from the pipes and meter.
Section 78- Responsibility for leaks (Mains and Personal Service Lines)
All ordinary leaks developing in water mains will be repaired by the Division
of Water and Sewer without cost to any individual property owner. All leaks or
damages to private service mains or service lines (from and after the
corporation stop) must be repaired by the individual property owner at his
expense.
Section 79- Leaks in Fire Lines and Inactive Service Lines
The cost of repairing inactive services or services supplying fire lines must
be paid by the owner.
Section 80- Deteriorated service lines must be repaired at owner's expense
When a service connection is found to have deteriorated to the extent that
permanent repairs cannot be made, or it is determined by the Deputy Service
Director that the service line is of substandard materials, a new service will
be required to be installed at the expense of the owner; and failure of the
owner, upon notification, to authorize such new service to be installed will be
deemed sufficient cause for discontinuing the supply of water to the premises
without further notice. During the winter months, allow five days, including
weekends, for the homeowner to make repairs. During the summer months, allow 10
days including weekends, for the homeowner to make repairs.
   a)    When a water service is found to contain any portion of lead service,
the owner will be required to replace that portion within 30 days of notice.
Section 81- The portion of the service main between the corporation stop and
meter is maintained at the owner's expense
That portion of the service main between the corporation stop and meter must be
maintained at the expense of the property owner. Accordingly, the property
owner will be held responsible for any leakage which may occur in such service
main; and the Division of Water and Sewer reserves the right to turn off the
water in cases where such leakages are not corrected after proper notices to do
so. The Division of Water and Sewer will make such repairs at the expense of
the property owner. Actual charges will be based on time, equipment, materials,
etc. determined by the Deputy Service Director. All charges will be billed to
the property owner on the quarterly water bill and, if unpaid, will be turned
over to the Mahoning County Auditor for collection on property taxes.
Section 82- When Connections for Fire Protection Will Be Permitted
The installation of fire protection service connections to supply water to
stand pipes and sprinkler systems for FIRE PROTECTION ONLY shall be permitted
when applications and plans for such services have been submitted to and
approved by the Deputy Service Director.
Section 83- Two or More Fire Connections
When any premise has two (2) or more fire service connections, each service
shall be equipped with a check valve, easily accessible, so set that water can
flow into the premises but cannot flow out.
Section 84- Pipes Intended for Fire Protection
Pipes intended for fire protection must not be tapped or used for general water
supply of any premises, except by special permission of the Deputy Service
Director.
Section 85- Consumer Water Volume & Pressure
The Division of Water and Sewer does not assure the consumer full volume, the
required pressure or continuous service necessary to effectually operate the
branch fire equipment, all being subject to the variable conditions which may
take place in connection with the operation of a water works system.
CHAPTER SIX
SANITATION
Section 86- Allowable Water Sources
No source of water supply other than that maintained by the Municipality shall
be in any way connected with the Water Works System; nor will water from any
other source be allowed to enter the Water Works System.
All water mains, lines and connections shall be constructed in such a manner as
to prevent any foreign substance passing back into the Water Works System.
Section 87- Owner is responsible to maintain sewer laterals
The Division of Water and Sewer shall repair or cause to be repaired all sewer
mains under the supervision of the Deputy Service Director; all laterals and
other sewer lines shall be maintained and repaired at the expense of the
property owner.
Section 88- Depth of service lines - at least four feet
Water service pipes connecting the curb box and the individual building or
structure shall be at least four feet (4') below the surface and not nearer
than thirty inches (30") to any sewer or gas lines.
Section 89- Who is authorized to work on water & sewer lines
No one except the authorized agents and employees of the Division of Water and
Sewer and licensed plumbers and acting directly under the authority and
supervision of the Deputy Service Director is permitted to tap, change, repair
or in any manner affect, modify or tamper with any water or sewer line or
connection, except under conditions in these Regulations specifically provided
for.
Section 90- Dumping refuse, waste…is strictly prohibited
The dumping or depositing of any refuse, waste rubbish, dirt or filth on or
about any pump station land, valve, curb stop, fire hydrant, sewer manhole and
Sewage Treatment Plant grounds is expressly prohibited. The entering into or
upon any pumping station buildings or the tampering or interference with any
apparatus or equipment incident to or appurtenant to any such buildings or
location is expressly forbidden except by duly authorized agents and employees
of the Municipality of Sebring.
Section 91- New construction and sewer use
Any person being the owner of lots or lands in the Municipality of Sebring
along which there has been constructed or may hereafter be constructed, a sewer
available for public use shall cause the building or building on said premises
to be connected with such public sewer promptly when available, and it is
hereby declared unlawful to use any cesspool, vault or other receptacle for the
disposal of sewage upon such premises; and those in use at such time as public
sewer is made available shall forthwith be cleaned out and filled up under the
direction of the Deputy Service Director.
CHAPTER SEVEN
MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS
Section 92- Employees must have badge or proper credentials to enter private
property
Officers, inspectors, meter readers and employees whose duty it may be to enter
upon private property for the purpose of inspection, reading, adjustment,
repair or the like shall be provided with a badge or other proper credentials
by the Municipal Manager, and upon exhibiting the same to the owner of the
property, they shall be granted free and unobstructed access at any reasonable
time to whatever part of the property that may be necessary to perform their
lawful duties.
Section 93- "Read your meter" card/estimated meter reads
If, after making an attempt, the person charged with the duty of reading water
meters is unable to gain entrance to the meter due to cause attributable to the
user of such meter, the meter reader shall leave a "Read Your Meter" card at
the premises served. It is the duty of the property owner or consumer to fill
out the card and return it to the Administrative Assistant within five (5) days
of deposit at the premises. In the event that the card is not returned timely,
then such property owner shall be charged for that quarter an amount equal to
the last preceding full quarter in which a reading of such meter has been made.
Such charge shall constitute a payment on account and the true charge adjusted
when the first succeeding quarterly reading is obtainable. If a meter reading
is so prevented for two successive quarters, the Municipality reserves the
right to disconnect the service, without approval by Council.
Section 94- Water/sewer charges are based on consumption
Whenever service, either water or sewer, is charged for upon the basis of water
consumption, the correct meter reading shall be held to be conclusive without
change or adjustment except under the conditions and in the manner in these
Regulations specifically defined.
Section 95- Fire hydrant tampering is not permitted
Under no circumstances shall any person except duly authorized agents or
employees of the Department of Public Service or the Sebring Fire Department
tamper with, draw water from, obstruct, or disturb any fire hydrant or part
thereof.
Section 96- Violating any Water Rules & Regulations
Whosoever being the owner of property receiving sewer or water service or the
user, consumer or patron of such service violates any of the provisions of
these Regulations shall forfeit his right to such service until the violation
has been removed and the resultant loss or injury to the Municipality,
including the actual cost and expense incident to disconnection and
reconnection of the service lines has been fully satisfied. Whoever violates
any of the rules and/or regulations promulgated herein shall be deemed guilty
of a minor misdemeanor as defined in Sebring Codified Ordinance No. 501.99(a).
Each day's continued violation shall be considered a separate offense.
Section 97- Nothing may obstruct fire hydrants  
Bushes, plantings, flowers, etc are not permissible within 10 feet of a fire
hydrant.
Section 98- Fire Department's Use of Fire Hydrants Not to be Interfered With
Fire hydrants are intended primarily for the use of the Fire Department, and
such use must not in any way be interfered with. Permits for their use for
other purposes are given reluctantly only in cases where their use cannot be
avoided and penalties for their unauthorized use are provided by Ordinance as
well as by these Regulations.
Section 99- Penalty for Operating Fire Hydrants Unlawfully
Operating of fire hydrants and the drawing of water therefrom by unauthorized
persons is strictly prohibited. Violators will be required to pay an assessed
fee of One Thousand Dollars ($1000.00) to cover expense and damages incurred,
as well as being subject to such other penalties as may be provided by law.
Section 100- What Persons are Authorized to Operate Fire Hydrants
No person except an authorized employee of the Division of Water and Sewer or
the Fire Department or the Division of Streets shall open, operate or remove
the nozzle cap from any public or private fire hydrant to which water is
supplied in whole or in part by the Water Works, or draw water therefrom except
for the purpose of extinguishing fires without first having secured the
necessary permit to do so.
Section 101- Permits May be Issued for the Use of Fire Hydrants
At the discretion of the Deputy Service Director, a special permit may be
issued for the use of a fire hydrant for securing a supply of water for
construction purposes in cases where a permanent supply or connection will not
be required. All water used from hydrants must be metered and have a backflow
valve installed, and a set up fee of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) will be
charged. Actual charges for water will be based upon the metered consumption.
Section 102- Permits for the Use of Fire Hydrants May Be Revoked
The right is reserved to revoke any permit for the use of fire hydrant for
violation of any of these regulations.
Section 103- Necessary Connections for Fire Hydrants
Fire hydrants used for construction purposes must have a reducing coupling
attached to the nozzle of the hydrant with independent valve for regulation of
the supply. The main valve of the fire hydrant must be opened full at the
beginning of each work day and remain open until stoppage of work for the day,
the water supply to be regulated by the independent valve. The fire hydrant is
to be operated only by a hydrant wrench to be supplied at a nominal fee by the
Division of Water and Sewer. At the close of the day's work the fire hydrant is
to be completely disconnected so as to be available for use by the Fire
Department or at any other time when so required.
Section 104- No Fire Hydrant Leaks will be tolerated
In taking water from a fire hydrant for construction or other purposes, no
leakage whether from hydrant hose, connection, cart, tank or wagon will be
tolerated.
Section 105- Water to be Furnished Free to Municipal Buildings
Water shall be furnished free for municipally-owned buildings and institutions,
but in such buildings or institutions meters shall be required to be installed
under the same regulations covering private consumers.
Section 106- Free Water for "Other" Municipal Buildings
Free water also shall be furnished for the use of the Department of Public
Service, the Department of Public Safety and for facilities operated by the
Park and Recreation Board.
Section 107- Waste and Unnecessary Consumption Not Permitted
In the providing of free water for public purposes, the Division of Water and
Sewer reserves to itself the right to prevent waste and excessive and
unnecessary consumption by such means as it may deem necessary, even to denying
service to the offending building, institution, department or division until
the abuses have been corrected.
Section 108- Mains Not to be Laid in Ungraded Streets
No water main extensions shall be made in ungraded streets having a grade
established where excessive cuts are necessary, nor in any streets having
established grade.
Section 109- Mains Will Not be Laid in Private Property
No water mains will be laid in any street or other location until it shall be
dedicated to public use in a lawful and regular manner unless all property
owners on such undedicated street or location sign and have properly recorded a
grant giving the Municipality of Sebring the right, title and easement in,
through and over such property as may be necessary for the location,
installation, examination, maintenance and repair of such mains.
Section 110- Main Outside Corporate Limits Not to be Financed by Division of
Water and Sewer
The Division of Water and Sewer will not finance directly any extension or
installation of water mains in territory or sections outside the corporation
limits of Sebring, Ohio.
Section 111- Council to be Petitioned for New Water Mains
Owners of property on streets within the corporate limits in which no water
mains have been laid who desire main extensions made in such streets shall
petition the Council for the Extensions and be assessed for same.
Section 112- Financing Must be Available to Extend Water Mains
The extension of water mains is subject in every case to the ability of the
Division of Water to finance same to the sufficiency of the guaranteed income
and to the availability of surplus water.
CHAPTER EIGHT
RULES FOR GOVERNING PLUMBERS
Section 113- Service Pipe Depth
All service pipes up to the curb stop and waste stop inside of the house shall
have a covering of not less than forty eight inches (48") of earth. The pipe
must run in through the foundation and be furnished with a stop and waste stop.
Where there is no cellar, stop and waste stop must be furnished with a "T"
handle coming up through the floor convenient for the water to be shut off
inside the house.
Old Services: In extending a service from the curb box to premises, no plumber
will be permitted to make use of pipe previously run from the main to the curb
which does not conform to rules existing at the time such service is to be
extended; but before making such connection, the plumber or owner must first
get the Deputy Service Director either to reject or consent to such connection.
If rejected, the owner will be required to have it changed at his expense and
if an entirely new service shall be put in, the old one shall be disconnected
at the main before the water is turned on to the new service. Plumbers must not
extend pipes from one street number to another.
Service Inspection: All runs of pipe whether original or on extension work
outside of buildings and all disconnected service must be inspected by the
Division of Water and Sewer before being covered up. When it becomes necessary
to make a second or additional inspection of rejected work a charge of Fifty
Dollars ($50.00) shall be made for such inspection.
Size of Taps: In case of each application, the Division of Water and Sewer
reserves the right to specify the sizes of taps to inserted in the mains as
well as the size and kind of pipe to be used.
Water Mains Under Control of the Division of Water and Sewer: The water mains
are under the exclusive control of the Division of Water and Sewer and its
authorized agents and employees. All other persons are forbidden to disturb,
tap, change, obstruct access to or interfere with them in any way.
Miscellaneous Rules for Plumbers: It shall be unlawful for any plumber or any
other person to introduce a ferrule or other fixture into the pipes of said
Water Works System or in any manner attach thereto or attach any fixture to any
service pipe connected with the Water Works System pipes or to remove any
fixture or in any manner alter any service pipe connected with the Water Works
System without first having a permit therefore, signed by the proper officers,
and every person receiving a permit shall in all respects conform to all and
singular of the Regulations which not exist or may hereafter be enacted; and a
violation of this rule shall subject the offender to forfeit his rights to
obtain permits and to a fine in any sum not exceeding One Thousand Dollars
($1000.00) and costs of a lawsuit.
It is provided, however, that the above restriction in relation to obtaining
permits is not to prevent a plumber from rendering in case of accident to the
service pipes occurring during the night or at hours when the Division's office
is closed, the regulation only requiring in such cases that the permit shall be
taken out immediately after opening of the office thereafter.
Consumers requiring large supplies of water for manufacturing purposes and who
at the same time require from their extra large attachments water for ordinary
domestic purposes shall reduce the branches for the latter purposes down to the
established sizes. For supplying laundries, garages, hotels, hospitals,
railroad stations and manufacturers requiring large quantities of water, the
character and size of attachments shall be determined by the Deputy Service
Director in view of the quantities of water required.
Any plumber who has made any connection of service pipe with the water main, or
who has made repairs to any private hydrant or other fixture connected with or
attached to the Water Works System pipes, or who has made any addition to any
tap, service pipe, water stop or other fixture on or in any premises or
buildings shall make a return, setting forth the nature and extent of such
change. In case of the suspension of any part of contemplated work for any
cause, it shall be the duty of the plumber to make a return of work for any
cause; it shall be the duty of the plumber to make a return of the work as far
as completed. Any plumber who shall violate the provisions of this section
shall be held liable for all unpaid bills, that is water rents, accruing from
such service, previous to the discovery of such violation.
No plumber shall allow his name to be used by any person or party, either for
the purpose of obtaining permits or doing any work under his name. Neither
shall plumbers loan to water takers any key for turning on or off the water
without a permit from the Deputy Service Director or his authorized agent.
No plumber shall be permitted to enter the pipe or conduct water into any two
distinct premises or tenements unless separate and distinct stops shall be
placed on the outside of such premises on the pavement or in the alley opposite
the same, nor shall pipe be allowed to cross lots or adjoining premises. Every
service pipe must be furnished with a curb stop below the action of the frost
so situated that the water can be conveniently shut off and drained from pipes
when necessary to prevent freezing.
Every service pipe must be laid at a uniform depth of forty eight inches (48")
below the surface and sufficiently waiving so as to allow no less than six
inches (6") extra length to prevent rupture by settlement of the earth; pipe
used to convey water into the premises shall not be less than ¾" copper pipe.
No one except employees of the Division of Water and Sewer, plumbers and
licensed excavators is allowed to open trenches in streets and alleys for
laying service pipe to the water mains, inserting ferrules or attending to
repairs. All service lines crossing a dedicated municipal street must be bored.
No road cuts will be permitted on a dedicated street.
Where service pipes have been brought to or inside the curb line to a curb stop
or continued to the cellar foundation of a building and closed, a permit will
be necessary for the further continuation of the service pipe unless an
extension is made to the same within thirty (30) days.
Taps 2" or less in diameter shall be performed only by the Deputy Service
Director or his assistant; taps exceeding 2" in diameter will be performed by a
designee of the Deputy Service Director.
Any permit may be revoked for any failure to comply with these Rules or for any
misconduct on the part of the plumber or his employees, or for any good or
sufficient reason satisfactory to the Deputy Service Director.
Turning Off Water: In no case shall any plumber after completion or trial on
any job of new plumbing work leave the water open on the premises; and he shall
in all cases close the curb stop at the box and report in writing to the
Division of Water and Sewer.
Testing Work: The water must not be turned on to any premises except by the
employees of the Division of Water and Sewer, but may be temporarily turned on
by the plumber to test the work and be turned off immediately after the test is
made. All plumbing must be thoroughly tested before a report is made at the
Division Office.
Plumbers Only: Permits shall be granted to the plumber except that in
manufacturing plants employing their own machinists or pipe fitters, special
permits may be granted at the option of the Deputy Service Director for the
work to be done on the premises only, and provided that such work shall not be
done for other parties.
The plumbers shall have supervision of the trenching and laying of service
pipes. The plumbers shall comply with the rules of the Division of Water and
Sewer and the specifications in their permits; and in case trenches are open
during the night, they shall see that the same are properly protected by
barriers and signal lamps.
Management: The authorized agents of the Division of Water and Sewer are the
sole persons who may lawfully interfere with anything pertaining to or
belonging to the Water Works System or the management thereof. No unauthorized
person shall be permitted to tap, make any connection or attachment with or to
the main distributing pipes of the Water Works System or to turn on the water
again at any point or place where it has been turned off on the order of the
Division of Water and Sewer, or by any of its officers or employees The use of
fire hydrants, except in case of fire, is strictly forbidden; and it shall be
unlawful for any unauthorized person to remove the stop, cover any fire plug or
the private stop of any street sprinkler or hydrant in such curb boxes or do or
commit any act tending to obstruct the use thereof, or injure or deface in any
manner any building, machinery, pipe, tools, or fixtures of the Water Works
System or the Division of Water and Sewer.
The Deputy Service Director shall have charge of all tools and fixtures for
pipe laying and repairs and he shall have the care of breaks and leaks and
shall repair the same as soon as practicable.
He shall have full charge both of the Pumping and Filtration plants. He must
approve all order for supplies for operation, improvement of the grounds,
buildings and machinery. Also, the Chief Operator shall keep a record of
supplies consumed for the year ending December 31st together with the number of
gallons of water pumped during the year.
It shall be the duty of the Deputy Service Director in the month of January,
annually, to submit an inventory of the tools, pipe castings, gate valves,
hydrants and other property on hand at the pipe yard or workshop to the
Municipal Manager.
CHAPTER NINE
ENACTMENT, SEVERABILITY, EFFECTIVE DATE
Section 114- Councils' Right to Change and/or Amend Rules at Any Time
The Council reserves the right, at any time, to change, amend or add to these
Regulations; and in all matter not specifically provided of herein, to make
such special rules, rates and regulations as may be fair and proper.
Section 115
Each section of these Regulations and each subdivision of any section thereof
is hereby declared to be independent and the finding or holding of any section
or subdivision of any section thereof to be invalid or void, shall not be
deemed or held to effect the validity of any other section or subdivision of
these Regulations.
Section 116- Regulations are promulgated by Council's action
These Regulations are promulgated by the action of Council pursuant to the
authority of the Charter of the Municipality of Sebring and Section 729.51 of
the Ohio Revised Code.
Section 117- By making application, owner agrees to these Regulations
Each property owner using the Water and/or Sewer service provided by the
Division of Water and Sewer shall be governed by and shall be deemed to have
agreed to be so governed by making application for such service(s), all of the
Ordinances and Regulations relative to the construction, maintenance and
operation of the Water and Sewer systems; and the same shall extend to all
consumers of said service(s) whether located within or without the corporate
limits of the Municipality of Sebring, Ohio; and the jurisdiction of the
Division of Water and Sewer.
Section 118
These Regulations shall take effect and be in force from and after the 22nd day
of April 2019.
